author: mklement0
body:
If you specify a default noun prefix for a module's functions with the `DefaultCommandPrefix` module-manifest entry, the module's functions aren't properly discovered by the auto-loading / command-discovery mechanisms:

* If you try to invoke a function _with_ its default noun prefix, auto-loading isn't performed, and the invocation fails.

* If you try to invoke a function _without_ its default noun prefix, auto-loading of the module _is_ (unexpectedly) performed, but the function invocation then (sensibly) fails, because the function name isn't correct.


# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Describe "DefaultCommandPrefix / module auto-loading integration" {
  BeforeAll {
    $psmpBefore = $env:PSModulePath
    $env:PSModulePath += [IO.Path]::PathSeparator + (Convert-Path testdrive:\)
    Push-Location testdrive:\
    $null = mkdir Foo
    New-ModuleManifest -Path Foo/Foo.psd1 -DefaultCommandPrefix Pre -RootModule Foo.psm1 -FunctionsToExport *
    'function Get-Foo { "foo" }' > Foo/Foo.psm1
    gci Foo | out-host
  }
  It "The prefixed function name should trigger auto-loading" {
    { Get-PreFoo } | Should -Not -Throw
  }
  It "The unprefixed function name should not trigger auto-loading" {
    try { Get-Foo } catch {  }
    Get-Module Foo -EA Ignore | Should -BeNullOrEmpty
  }

  AfterAll {
    Pop-Location
    $env:PSModulePath = $psmpBefore
  }
}
```

# Expected behavior

The tests should pass.

# Actual behavior

Both tests fail:

```none
Expected no exception to be thrown, but an exception "The term 'Get-PreFoo' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program
```

and 

```
Expected $null or empty, but got @(Foo).
```

# Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.1.0-preview.3
```

comments.author: MatejKafka
comments.body:
As it currently is, the `DefaultCommandPrefix` is basically unusable, as its correct functionality requires the module to be manually loaded.

Is there any workaround that could be used until this is fixed?

title: Default noun prefix (DefaultCommandPrefix) not integrated with module auto-loading / command discovery
